edu.washington.cs.touchfreelibrary.sensors
Class GestureSensor

java.lang.Object
  edu.washington.cs.touchfreelibrary.sensors.ClickSensor
      edu.washington.cs.touchfreelibrary.sensors.GestureSensor

public class GestureSensor
extends ClickSensor

GestureSensor takes input data from the camera and uses that to sense four gesture commands: up, down, left, and right.

Important: The static function loadLibrary must be called after OpenCV is initiated and before GestureSensor is instantiated!

Author:
Leeran Raphaely

Nested Class Summary
static interface GestureSensor.Listener
          To receive messages from GestureSensor, classes must implement the GestureSensor.Listener interface.

Constructor Detail

GestureSensor

public GestureSensor(Context context)
Creates a new instance of GestureSensor. Remember to call loadLibrary

Parameters:
context - A Context object needed to get the screen rotation.
Method Detail

loadLibrary

public static void loadLibrary()
To use a GestureSensor object, this must be called some time after OpenCV is initiated.

addGestureListener

public void addGestureListener(GestureSensor.Listener listener)
Adds listener to the list of gesture listeners.

Parameters:
listener - This object will have its call-back methods called when a gesture is recognized

removeGestureListener

public void removeGestureListener(GestureSensor.Listener listener)
Removes listener from the list of gesture listeners

Parameters:
listener - The object will no longer have its call-back mehtods called by this gesture sensor.

clearGestureListeners

public void clearGestureListeners()
Removes all gesture listeners.

enableHorizontalScroll

public void enableHorizontalScroll(boolean enabled)
Enable/disable horizontal scroll.

Parameters:
enabled - When true, onGestureLeft/onGestureRight are called, when false, they are not.

isHorizontalScrollEnabled

public boolean isHorizontalScrollEnabled()
Test if horizontal scroll is enabled.

Returns:
true if horizontal scroll is enabled, false otherwise.

enableVerticalScroll

public void enableVerticalScroll(boolean enabled)
Enable/disable vertical scroll.

Parameters:
enabled - When true, onGestureUp/onGestureDown are called, when false, they are not.

isVerticalScrollEnabled

public boolean isVerticalScrollEnabled()
Test if vertical scroll is enabled.

Returns:
true if vertical scroll is enabled, false otherwise.

enableClickByColor

public void enableClickByColor(boolean enabled)
When enabled, an onSensorClick command is sent to any click listeners when a large enough percentage of the screen goes black.

Parameters:
enabled - Set whether click-by-color is enabled

isClickByColorEnabled

public boolean isClickByColorEnabled()
Test if click by color is enabled.

Returns:
true if click by color is enabled, false otherwise.

start

public void start()

Causes this to start reading camera input and looking for gestures. The camera must be available for this method to be successful.

Warning! GestureSensor will seize control of the front facing camera, even if the activity loses focus. If you would like to let other applications use the camera, you must call stop() when the activity loses focus.

Specified by:
start in class ClickSensor

stop

public void stop()
Stops this from looking at camera input for gestures, thus freeing the camera for other uses.

Specified by:
stop in class ClickSensor

setAverageColorMaxForClick

public void setAverageColorMaxForClick(double c)
If ClickByColor is enabled, then when the mean color of the pixels is below c, register a click.

Parameters:
c - the maximum average color of the pixels received by the camera for a click to be registered
